Name: 0_people_like_skinny_im
Representative_Docs: ['sick of ed’s being normalised . I came across a post today, a girl on tiktok, and she was talking about how “skinny is life, skinny is wealth, skinny is class” is nobody hearing themselves? i feel like the world has gone insane. she was saying that “fat people look trashy in designer” and so much damaging stuff and it’s so fucking annoying because it’s that mindset becoming popular that stops people recovering im so sick of it. celebrities are getting thinner, everyone’s talking about ozempic, the “big bac', 'This is so incredibly shallow but I do it because I want people to envy me. when I see models n other people extremely skinny I get so jealous sometimes I can’t breathe (really). And I want people to look at me and feel the same. I feel like I have nothing in my life that anybody would wanna be jealous of, except for maybe my body if I put in the work. I also just want people to like me.', 'do some people just not look good skinny? . i’m having an existential crisis as of late bc i’m realizing that, instead of how i always pictured i’d look skinny (for me), i actually look like a fucking starved polar bear. like i hate how i look thinner, its so unnatural, but i under no circumstances want to stop losing/ gain weight (i am normal bmi right now). in your opinion, do some people just not look good skinny? is there any way i can counteract this?? for reference i am a rather large-ish person just']

Name: 1_ozempic_weight_people_im
Representative_Docs: ['But ozempic is prescription-only, isn’t it?', 'Is that not ozempic ?', 'Ozempic.']

Name: 2_weight_people_loss_effects
Representative_Docs: ['Same. It seemed like the golden ticket... I wanted it so bad. Even got in a position where I could have been prescribed it. My sister went on it and lost soooooo much weight in like <number> months - the amount it would take me <number> years to lose. I had to deep dive research on the side effects and long-term effectiveness to talk myself out of it. So glad I did. Working really hard on healing my relationship with food... and feel like that has far more long-term effectiveness. My sister went off it and returned immed', "While I understand why you have that point of view, the research supporting using it for weight loss is pretty solid, and there is nothing wrong with people choosing to use drugs for weight loss. Just like it's unreasonable to penalize people for being overweight, we shouldn't prevent people from using tools that could legitimately make their lives better. People who meet the clinical criteria should have access to the drugs; that doesn't mean people like OP or celebrities are trying to lose a few pounds, b", 'I don’t want to try it because: A) I don’t have a diabetic condition and don’t want to take away needed medication that is meant for them. (Many people who need the drug are now having a hard time getting it because other people are buying it in mass for weight loss.) B) It’s expensive. C) It’s somewhat of a newer drug and we don’t have information about long term use and potential side effects. D) I have also heard of people taking it and then when they stopped using it they ended up gaining double']

Name: 3_pad_scale_walking pad_walking
Representative_Docs: ['grenade protein bars, a million different protein flavors, monk fruit sweetener, low cal sparkling tea, a scale that works, one of those experimental multivitamins with a bunch of thing that might contribute to weight loss, vyvanse because it’s approved for binge eating (yes it’s not sold on amazon ik), konkac jelly, a working treadmill/general exercise equipment i can keep at home, a personal trainer who will magically appear at my house and tell me exactly what workout to do, electrolyte powder, tazo tea', 'Walking pad.', "A walking pad treadmill, fitness watch, ankle weights, pilates mat, insane amount of Grenade bars and shakes, many different flavours of protein powder, loads of instant noodles to OMAD, appetite suppressants, apple cider vinegar (idk if I believe it helps weight loss but I wanna try it), lifetime supply of Aldi protein yogurts, various fun teabag flavours and <number> sugar syrups, and tasty broths to drink, white Monster, konjac noodles, cauliflower rice... And much more I can't currently think of Edit: NINJA C"]

Name: 4_money_would_id_pay
Representative_Docs: ['Off topic, but how is college <money> ? Can you break down the amount per degree and w/ or w/o dorm? My bachelor’s was about <money> w/ financial aid to out of state big name school. I had my own apt after the 1st yr which was significantly cheaper than dorms. The masters was gonna cost <money> but I got sick and also could not afford that. The masters at the time was the top degree in my field at the time. And is the <money> before/after interest? I honestly don’t know how you guys afford that. My bachelor’s at', 'depends on if it had side effects, but if it were actually a "magical" cure with no risk, i\'d pay extreme amounts of money. like i\'m talking five figures, maybe six, and i\'m not rich by any means, i\'d seriously take out loans. i think it would be a significant return on investment bc i\'m already paying like 400k for my college tuition, and my ed is significantly harming my academic and professional development. like it\'s the main factor standing in my way, and if i could live up to my full potential i could', "I would sell my soul for Ozempic (rant). Yes, I know there are obviously people who need it much more than me and I could never afford it, anyway. But holy shit, I would genuinely be willing to have a finger removed if I could get it. I cannot stop binge eating no matter what. I've tried everything (yes, everything) and I just cannot stop eating. I used to purge, but now that my teeth are fucked I can't do that anymore. I'm gaining weight faster than I ever have in my whole life and often (like right now)"]

Name: 5_shes_mom_weight_eating
Representative_Docs: ["My best friend started a weightloss drug and it's triggering me so bad.. My best friend has always struggled with her weight. She has a double whammy of hypothyroidism and PCOS. Because of that is was really difficult for her to lose any weight. Her family is French and are extremely harsh to her about her weight and she has internalized a lot of it. I never thought she needed to lose weight. I always thought she looked beautiful and healthy. Back in March she started the weightloss drug Wegovy. Essential", 'Am I wrong for being annoyed at my ozempic mom and her food talk?. My ozempic mom is driving me crazy with her food talk. It\'s nonstop -- yesterday it\'s her declining a cookie before we ski because "I don\'t think I can handle all that pure sugar and fat before we ski" (while my sister and I were already eating one). A normal portion at a restaurant = "wow this is just so much food." Today I was baking a cake and it was just incessant. It looked like a mini version of one we had on a picnic years ago which', 'I didn’t even think of that, but I could see how having friends like this would make you want to never go out with them. I mean if she legit doesn’t want it, just eat what you want and take the rest home for the next day. I love making restaurant food last for several meals, especially in this economy :p. Bonus points if you just do it like it’s nothing - like unlike her you have years of practicing not eating enormous portions and would never order food without a « plan », because you know better.']

Name: 6_ed_eds_like_one
Representative_Docs: ['Ed or just borderline. I feel like an imposter in most things, and I\'m trying to decide if I want to talk to my doctor or he\'ll just see me as a hypochondriac. I don\'t need/want an ED label, but I kinda want to know where I am on the spectrum and see how much is "dude, just try harder, that is all pretty standard stuff" vs "you could use some external help". I know rules say no serious med advice. I\'m not using this thread to diagnose. I know many people have it far more complicated and difficult. I\'m ju', 'Thanks for posting this. I’m one of those people that does feel like a loser seeing everyone just melt their fat off of them. My primary ED has always been MIA but I’ve stopped for a long time but have HUGE body image issues. I’ve been having the hardest time losing my recommended weight of 25lb to be put in the “normal” range. I’m even doing cal counting and everything for the past month but seeing everyone get on those medications make me so tempted but what’s keeping me away is the potential side ef', 'i’m not an ed influencer but i do other internet things and often push through my lack of mental energy to make stuff anyway that stuff starts to affect them but if you, for example, have adhd like me, you can sort of “mute” needs. like needing to pee but putting it off so long that it goes away. i’ve had no energy cuz of my ed for years but when my depression isn’t keeping me chained to the sofa, even if my lack of energy wants to, i just ignore it. obviously this has consequences. it’s kinda like if y']

Name: 7_thank_makes_sense_makes sense
Representative_Docs: ['Makes sense… makes me feel somewhat better haha, thank you!', 'This. Thank you for putting it in a way that makes sense. I’ve had zero luck trying to explain this before.', 'Thank you!❤️']

Name: 8_food_hunger_feeling_eating
Representative_Docs: ['You never got an answer on this. First of all if you have a diagnosed eating disorder, they won’t give it to you. It’s been linked to making these worse, because it basically causes one. It’s like an eating disorder without all the crap of being hungry. Secondly, if you went on it it’s going to ultimately make it worse. Yes you will be full, all the time, and not be able to eat, which might remove the mental aspect of food and eating, but unless you are on it forever it’s just going to get worse once yo', "The guilt of eating ANYTHING is exhausting me !!!!!!!. Completely normal meal? Guilt! Tiny meal of xxx calories? Guilt! OMAD? Guilt! Skip breakfast and then have lunch? Guilt! Have a snack? You guessed it, guilt! Doing just fine, & then someone brings up weight loss/ozempic/calories/etc.... guilt over everything I've eaten today. God forbid I actually overeat! The guilt is all-consuming. So fucking tired of feeling extremely guilty like I'm a murderer or something over.... eating like a normal person", "I understand getting used to the feeling of hunger, because hunger is usually temporary and goes away after a while even if you don't eat, plus if you ignore your hunger cues repeatedly, your body will give you less and less. BUT what about the low energy feeling? That's what I struggled with when restricting, because the lack of energy never went away and actually got worse and worse over time. So it's actually a good question OP, how are people exercising, dealing with active jobs, etc. Aside from lyi"]

Name: 9_control_im_life_feel
Representative_Docs: ["I'm relapsing because my life feels very out of control right now (job especially) and I can't control what others do, just what I put in my mouth. When I restrict (well, eat at my set calories a day which is under what it should be) I feel in control, I feel strong, I feel worthy of something. I feel like I'm doing something right even if nothing else is going right.", 'similar control reasoning except its because if i am not restricting, i am actively suffering in every other part of my life. i cant function. but for some reason in this middle spot of restriction before shit hits the fan, i am for once in my life the kind of person who has it together. like i can really get stuff done. i have cptsd and i think its related to that as well. like focusing on this helps me unfocus on my trauma, and im able to function. if mental health care for people on medicaid was better', 'Control']

Name: 10_ads_ad_get_reddit
Representative_Docs: ['reddit count your days . whenever an app or site asks me if they want to track me for personal ads, i say no. however reddit is the ONLY APP WHERE I HAVE OZEMPIC ADS. sAVE THOSE MEDS FOR THE DIABETICS I DON’T WANT NOT CAN I AFFORD IT!! IT’S LIKE SHOWING AN ALCOHOLIC PUB ADVERTISEMENTS OR SHOWING A GAMBLE A CASINO AD I HATE THIS DYSTOPIAN TIME WE LIVE IN!! i hate it because i had a dream i was taking it bc my BED has gotten worse bc of christmas. even worse is i know that i can’t afford and it will stay in t', 'I believe there is an paid ad-free version of Reddit. Personally, Ozempic and other weight loss ads don’t bother me one bit. I can’t control the world around me and I certainly can’t force the world to mold to fit my personal triggers. I can’t force only control what I do. If you are so triggered, I’d recommend to stay off social media and the internet all together. Also, remember that ads are personally tailored to you. If you’re getting a lot of Ozempic and weight loss ads it’s because that’s what YOU are', "do you guys keep getting erectile dysfunction pill ads?. i keep getting blue chew ads on reddit. idk why. i'm not an avid porn watcher. i don't have a penis. but i keeps getting ads from them and the only possible reason i can think of for getting them is bc erectile dysfunction shortened is ED and i'm on this sub all the time. does the algorithm think i'm having erectile dysfunction? i'm not. idk it's better than ozempic ads. i tend not to get those anymore although i can't remember if it's bc i disabled"]

Name: 11_number_number number_tumblr_number tumblr
Representation: ['number', 'number number', 'tumblr', 'number tumblr', 'back number', 'tumblr number', 'livejournal', 'number number tumblr', 'swinging', 'back']
Representative_Docs: ['Yeah this is literally <number> - <number> Tumblr all over again', 'i feel like every <number> years EDs become “trendy” again. in <number> it was definitely at its peak, and in <number> it was tumblr, now it’s <number> and ozempic.', 'Aaah the livejournal pages and stuff? The first really rudimentary forums? When suddenly every teen with basic HTML skills threw as much glitter and fairies and butterflies on their food journal as they possibly could, killing every good old Win95 computer. These were the days. :D']

Name: 12_friend_sounds_shes_tough
Representative_Docs: ['You don’t need to apologize for anything, this is such a tough situation you are in and I just wanted to make sure I wasn’t coming off as dismissive of that. At this point she has to want to help herself, and hopefully having some space will help her to gain some clarity on how her behavior is affecting you and her own health. I hope you just know that none of this is your fault. You are not responsible for the way she is hurting herself at all. I understand why it feels that way, but I promise you as an', '“Tough love” and “too sensitive” are extremely toxic tactics employed by bullies in order to dismiss or minimize their abusive behavior. Not only is she insulting you, but she’s completely dismissing your hurt feelings and blaming it on you. This person is an asshole and is only going to continue hurting you. I would suggest telling them about your ED recovery and setting up clear boundaries or just cutting them off altogether.', "Tbh it sounds like she is projecting her insecurities onto you. Not excusable behaviour at ALL, but I can totally imagine she's riding the high of this being a huge novelty that for once in her life she's the one feeling like she has a right to hand out those comments instead of receive them. Not a true friend. And tbh if you plan on keeping her around I'd let her know why those comments are so damaging to you with your history in particular. She should be able to enjoy her own successes without shaming ot"]

Name: 13_shes_students_bathroom_puking
Representative_Docs: ['Coworker on Ozempic really triggering. So one of my coworkers is on ozempic and losing weight with it. She’s been kinda blatantly disordered about her weightloss since before she started ozempic, but since starting it’s only gotten worse. She’s also been violently vomiting in the student bathroom that is in my classroom. It’s not intentional, but it’s so frequent, and all she talks about how much she throws up and how much weight she’s losing and how it’s so great. Literally all she talks about is weight an', 'It’s so far beyond inappropriate to be talking about this and just walking throwing up in front of coworkers but even more so, impressionable STUDENTS. And her refusal to replenish her electrolytes with even a Gatorade zero is seriously alarming. As someone who has been hospitalized for hypokalemia, I can absolutely attest that her heart is going to suffer. I would talk to HR. I’m sorry you’re in this situation ❤️\u200d🩹', 'Another coworker has raised concern to her — like today, she’s thrown up <number> times and is literally carrying around a trash can to puke in, so the other coworker asked her if she at least wanted some Gatorade Zero to replenish her electrolytes. She said “No, I don’t even know how anyone can drink that, even the Zero sugar is so disgustingly sweet. I just can’t do anything like that, it grosses me out.” The other coworker then expressed more concern about her frequent vomiting, and noted that she knows this wo']

Name: 14_im_number_started_time
Representative_Docs: ['I lost a lot of weight in a healthy turned disordered way and finally got attention from guys, got so many compliments, and frankly I was starvinggg and ravenous. Started to binge, felt guilty and so sick, started to purge (felt so much better after, told myself it would only happen a few times. And here I am <number> years later a daily binge/purger with <money> + in dental work done. Not to mention the debt from so much binge food. I have gained/lost over the years and I’m losing again. Getting the “wow you look', 'I’m on ozempic and I am really skinny right now. I also lift weights. I get told constantly my body is insanely nice and I look like I’m about to step on stage. But I feel like shit all the time still obsessed with the scale to no end. In fact it’s worse than ever. I lost a lot of strength despite eating my protein. My body fat percentage is reaching essential level. I don’t feel well I’m sick all the time. My mental health is worse than ever. I look great and I’m still completely unhappy. Some guy I was se', "I can't take living with my family in this state. I want to be healthy. I want to recover. But it just feel so impossible every time I even consider it. I'm underweight, yet I still feel fat. I feel like I eat wayyyy to much to even be considered anorexic. No one seems to care unless I make comments about how i'm losing hair, or that I passed out this morning. My sisters diet consists of dessert for lunch, family dinner, then more dessert. She always talks about how she needs to eat less at dinner so she ha"]

Name: 17_face_eyes_sunken_cheeks
Representative_Docs: ['For me, I have a naturally rounder face so I never looked super “sunken in” but i did definitely lose my cheeks when I was severely uw. Aside from that, Pale, yellow or greyish dry skin. Bags or darkness and discoloration around the eyes. No light in the eyes.', 'Skin tight around the mouth and nose. Sunken cheeks/sharp cheekbones (depending on bone structure), sunken hollow eyes, no light in the eyes. For me I noticed my eye color dulled and is darker than when I was at a healthy weight. You’ll also notice that when an emaciated anorexic person smiles, the eyes still look hollow and there isn’t the “cheekiness” of the smile because there isn’t fat in the cheeks. Idk, it’s very obvious when you see it.', 'No obsses over it by all means Im nuts sadly so i get it. but dont kill your face. Your talking to someone who knows obsession and bodily harm well. I whip myself as punisment and i currently shaved off my eyebrows and hair. Been trying to take a dirt nap since <number> and i keep coming back im annoyed tbh. Feels like heaven and hell dont want me. But dont give yourself old lady face. Its bad bad. Like youll regret that forsure. Having the face of an <number> yearold woman youll look like a tweaker. But if thats yo']

Name: 18_noise_food noise_food_thoughts
Representative_Docs: ['For me personally, I’m pretty sure it had to do with my ADHD bc I have always had “food noise,” prior to any ED issues. Like my parents never restricted food from me, we never owned a scale, and are actually the two most intuitive eaters I know (all of this to say I don’t think I had an environmental reason to be so obsessive with food). Once I was diagnosed and medicated a few years ago, the food noise went away and I actually developed the healthiest relationship with food I have had in forever. I say t', 'Food Noise in AN Recovery. One of the most salient aspects for those on Ozempic/other drugs is the reduction of "food noise" – that incessant voice urging them to eat even if they are not hungry. As I\'ve engaged in recovery from Anorexia Nervosa, I\'m struck that my own "food noise" has been ratcheted up to <number> , even though I\'m weight restored and overshooting. Does this ever go away, or am I fated to be negotiating with these voices/urges for the rest of my life?', 'Food noise. I truly believe that food noise is behind a lot of ED behavior. Do you experience a lot of food noise? People who are on Ozempic say their food noise quiets down and I recognized what they were talking about immediately. Thoughts?']

Name: 19_sorry_mom_mother_im sorry
Representative_Docs: ['i understand, please dont be sorry i probably just misunderstood, life has been tough and i was probably just feeling defensive she definetly does but doesnt wanna listen to me when i try to help her out or take her out of denial, if you check my older posts i have multiple just asking about how i can make my mom realize she has an eating disorder. i really think she is using me as competition and thats whats hurting the most, i dont want to be the reason shes going out of her way to hurt herself even more', 'i cant, im sorry. i genuinely cant. you dont understand what kinda situations she puts herself in. i need to be there to take care of her. i know i shouldnt have to but i do. shes not forcing me to do it, noone is, but my conscience wouldnt allow me to just let her be. shes one of the only reasons im still alive. and please dont be sorry, its very horrible, but neither of my parents were ready to have a child and they did. i cant blame them because ever since the last second they didnt want to. and theyre t', 'i am <number> , yeah, please dont be sorry and thank you alot but this is just my life really and i love my mom. i wouldnt let her go no matter what and thats why im worried. i want to help her so desperately but a minor wanting to help an adult, specially their parent, feels almost impossible. also, yes.. but the other adults are so much worse. my mom is the best possible gaurdian i have. theres my father who has genuine religious psychosis, and always makes my ED worse, my mom makes comments and things that hurt']

Name: 21_glp number_glp_number_glp1
Representative_Docs: ['Nope, don\'t care at all and I kind of wish mods would address this topic so we could stop getting this post daily. I\'ve said this on here before but weight management and weight loss *IS* part of type <number> diabetes management, treatment, and prevention, so it is silly to try to divide glp1 usage between "valid diabetes prescription" and "dirty immoral evil weight loss prescription" considering the majority of people on it for the former will be achieving the latter and vice versa. There is no evidence that t', 'As someone who’s deep in the GLP- <number> community for the last two years (and been in remission for BED that entire time), this is hardly universally true. Most people I know have lost upwards of <number> - <percent> of their bodyweight, including at least a dozen morbidly obese people who’ve lost <percent> and counting. Many people end up lowering their dose at maintenance because they can’t stop losing otherwise. That aside, the GLP- <number> craze is clearly part of the problem. You have countless people experiencing the high of heavy', 'I’ve used GLP-1s to lose >! <number> lbs!< over the last year. I had bariatric surgery before that, went from >!HW of <number> lbs, surgery day I was <number> , stopped losing around <number> and now I am <number> !< I wouldn’t have been able to lose that last bit without the GLP- <number> , despite my surgery. The medication turns off the food noise. The medication itself doesn’t actually make you lose weight, it just helps you make better decisions when it comes to food - you can still very easily be on a GLP- <number> and maintain or even gain, I k']

Name: 23_ads_prescription_drugs_advertising
Representative_Docs: ['I personally don’t care what people do for themselves (as long as that does not create a shortage of the drug for the people that medically need it), but the ads are driving me crazy. On the platforms I mainly see them on (FB and IG), there are explicit ad settings that let you turn off ads for alcohol (if you’re a recovering alcoholic) and child products (if you’ve lost a child and are grieving), so there does not seem to be any _good_ reason that you can’t turn off ads for drugs known for weight loss if', '🎶The laaaand of the FREEEEE🎶 -market. Lol. Yes, ads for prescription medicines are legal and omnipresent in the US. The phrase “ask your doctor if your heart is healthy enough for sexual activity” from a Viagra ad lives in far too much free real estate in my brain. Like other people can quote childhood cartoons, I can quote commercials targeting old dudes with limp dicks 😶', 'I’m currently inpatient in the UK, and it has been simultaneously hilarious and depressing recently because adds for wl drugs keep popping up on the radio we always have on in the dining room during meals and snacks. Poor staff have to keep jumping up to change the channel, bless them 😅 Edit: this clearly isn’t just a USA issue, the ads on the radio in the UK have been from private medical providers (which have been slowly proliferating for years), letting their target audience know that despite not being']

Name: 24_weight_im_semaglutide_taking
Representative_Docs: ["Back in the height of my ED sibutramine was all the rage, and in my mind I would take one pill and drop 30lbs just like that. Fast forward after covid the stupid endocrinologist prescribed it to me to lose some weight faster, it didn't work for shit other than making me sweat like a pig. I did keto and lost much faster and currently doing some fasting and losing even faster and feeling healthy and good. Medicine is not always the way, and no one is talking about the future side effects as our bodies tend", 'I’m disappointed about some of the reactions to this medication on here, but also not surprised. Anything having to do with weight loss, how people lose weight, why people lose weight, if someone should lose weight, what constitutes disordered eating and EDs tend to be inflammatory topics that unfortunately continue to restrict a lot of our understanding of weight (gain & loss) and changing bodies. The cessation of the food noise when I started semaglutide was stunning. I didn’t even really grasp that f', 'My mother is taking it, she has been severely obese her entire adult life, someone who really does need the help as her visceral fat is severe and she is getting older, we have a good relationship, but I can see how it\'s leading to disordered restrictive behaviors in her, she gets so excited and happy to be losing weight and she tries to ride the high, she "forgets" to eat all day even though her entire life is run by her planner app on her phone and she never "forgets" anything else, the other day she got']

Name: 27_ads_settings_reddit_apps
Representative_Docs: ['If you are seeing ads on Reddit and want to turn them off you can limit specific topics. Go to settings, account settings, limit ads. It does help imo. Most of my ads are for Amazon products now.', 'I know for sure you can on Reddit and I’m pretty sure for instagram but some social media apps have the option to not see these ads. On Reddit go into account settings and you should be able to toggle off weight loss ads.', "adblockers. common ones do not work on reddit. you may look into a network-level adblocker. one can be put on a raspberry pi fairly easily and hooked up as the access point to your network. even if you've got little technical skill a tutorial should help you achieve this pretty easily. this will block ads at a network level which no website can really prevent. side note--are you cis M? you mentioned taking hormones. were you prescribed these because your hormone levels are permanently fucked from restricti"]
